. O
INTRODUCTION O

hexaferrite O
, O

( O

) O
is O
one O

most O

, O
excellent O
chemical O
stability O
and O
low O

cost O
[1–5] O
. O

graphene O
flakes O
depending O
on O
their O
shape O
, O
size O
and O
edge O
saturation O
keep O
the O
promise O
of O
variety O
of O
application O
in O
future O
nanospintronics O
. O

measured O
for O
the O
Co2TiSn O
film O
suggested O
that O
the O
electronic O
structure O
in O
this O
film O
is O
in O
agreement O
with O
the O
calculated O
density O
of O
states O
. O

section 8
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/18-09-2019-paper-2.pdf.json
Experimentally O
, O
the O
film O
exhibited O
an O
anomalous O
Hall O
conductivity O
of O
284 O
and O
180 O
S/cm O
at O
50 O
and O
300 O
K O
, O
respectively O
. O

section 8
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/18-09-2019-paper-2.pdf.json
The O
larger O
value O
of O
the O
measured O
anomalous O
Hall O
conductivity O
is O
attributed O
to O
the O
discussed O
skew O
scattering O
and O
side O
jump O
mechanisms O
. O

section 8
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/18-09-2019-paper-2.pdf.json
The O
present O
work O
emphasizes O
the O
potential O
of O
Co2TiSn O
for O
future O
spintronics O
applications O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/26-08-2019-paper-10.pdf.json
e O
I O
. O
INTRODUCTION O
Perovskite O
transition O
- O
metal O
oxides O
have O
been O
intensively O
studied1 O
due O
to O
their O
various O
intriguing O
physical O
properties O
, O
such O
as O
the O
ferroelectricity O
, O
complex O
charge O
, O
spin O
and/or O
orbital O
order O
, O
and O
some O
combined O
properties O
including O
magnetoelectric O
multiferroics2 O
and O
colossal O
magnetoresistance O
. O
3 O
In O
this O
family O
, O
the O
two O
- O
dimensional O
layered O
perovskite O
in O
K2NiF4 O
structure O
is O
particularly O
interesting O
because O
of O
the O
high O
- O
Tc O
superconductivity O

=V O
and O
Cr O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/26-08-2019-paper-10.pdf.json
In O
these O
two O
strongly O
correlated O
t2g O
systems O
, O
GGA+U B-METHOD
calculations O
show O
that O
the O
AFM O
- O
II O
state O
will O
have O
the O
lowest O
total O
energy O
when O
U O
is O
larger O
than O
a O
critical O
value O
Uc O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/26-08-2019-paper-10.pdf.json
But O
the O
optical O
conductivity O
spectra O
indicate O
that O
in O
both O
cases O
, O
Uc O
is O
overestimated O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/26-08-2019-paper-10.pdf.json
Analysis O
indicates O
that O
some O
cooperative O
changes O
in O
the O
ligand O
field O
such O
as O
JT O
or O
some O
other O
lattice O
distortions O
could O
reduce O
the O
Uc O
value O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/26-08-2019-paper-10.pdf.json
These O
changes O
in O
the O
electron O
- O
lattice O
interaction O
will O
induce O
further O
splitting O
of O
the O
degenerate O
t2g O
orbital O
just O
as O
U O
does O
, O
which O
is O
shown O
to O
be O
critical O
for O
the O
metal O
- O
insulator O
transition O
and O
stabilization O
of O
AFM O
- O
II O
configuration O
in O
these O
systems O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/26-08-2019-paper-10.pdf.json
In O
the O
M O
=V O
case O
, O
since O
the O
geometric O
structure O
in O
bulk O
or O
thin O
films O
is O
well O
comparable O
with O
the O
theoretical O
one O
and O
nearly O
has O
no O
orthorhombic O
distortion O
, O
such O
a O
kind O
of O
additional O
contribution O
from O
lattice O
distortion O
seems O
unlikely O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/26-08-2019-paper-10.pdf.json
In O
Sr2CrO4 O
, O
it O
has O
quite O
a O
large O
orthorhombic O
deviation O
from O
tetragonal O
symmetry O
in O
samples O

a O
simple O

distortion O
is O

to O
be O
quite O
efficient O
in O
decreasing O
the O
Uc O
value O

may O
not O

in O
samples O
. O

. O

that O
in O
the O
case O
of O
BiTeCl O
the O
experimental O
data O
cannot O
be O
reproduced O
by O
DFT O
. O

section 6
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/29-01-2020-part1-1303.4987v2.Many_body_effects_on_the_Rashba_type_spin_splitting_in_bulk_bismuth_tellurohalides.pdf.json
However O
, O
both O
the O
GW O
values O
of O
the O
bulk O
Rashba O
parameters O
and O
estimates O
for O
those O
of O
the O
surface O
state O
match O
the O
experimental O
values O
within O
the O
error O
bars O
of O
the O
experiment O
. O

section 6
id data_09-04-2020/fold1/train/29-01-2020-part1-1303.4987v2.Many_body_effects_on_the_Rashba_type_spin_splitting_in_bulk_bismuth_tellurohalides.pdf.json
As O
to O
BiTeBr O
, O
neither O
the O
DFT O
nor O
the O
GW O
approximation O
and O
the O
further O
estimate O
is O
able O
to O
reproduce O
simultaneously O
the O
available O
experimental O
data O
on O
ER O
, O
kR O
, O
and O
αR O
. O
6 O
